inclusion.criterion: Suspicion of prostate cancer due to elevated PSA, and/or palpable tumor in the prostate
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Indication for digital rectal examination and trans-rectal ultrasound with biopsy
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Able to provide informed written consent (competent adults only)
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Medical conditions that may interfere with the study such as previously cancer-related therapy
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Life expectancy of less than 10 years
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: MRI of the prostate within the last 2 years
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Digital rectal examination of the prostate within 24 hours or ejaculation within 24 hours
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: Patient is a 63-year-old man presenting to the Emergency Department with acute urinary retention. He has a large prostate and elevated PSA level, making him a candidate for urethral catheterization and TURP.
